destinations.title: Popular Destinations
destinations.subtitle: Explore Guatemala's most amazing destinations with detailed transportation guides. Each destination includes multiple route options, costs, and insider tips.

antigua.name: Antigua Guatemala
antigua.description: Colonial charm with cobblestone streets and volcanic backdrop

atitlan.name: Lake Atitlán
atitlan.description: Stunning volcanic lake surrounded by indigenous villages

tikal.name: Tikal National Park
tikal.description: Ancient Maya ruins in the heart of the jungle

semuc.name: Semuc Champey
semuc.description: Natural limestone pools in lush jungle setting

riodulce.name: Río Dulce
riodulce.description: Tropical river connecting lake to Caribbean coast

xela.name: Quetzaltenango (Xela)
xela.description: Guatemala's second city, gateway to highlands

ads.insuranceDesc: Protect your journey with comprehensive coverage
ads.shuttleDesc: Comfortable private shuttles to all destinations

safety.title: Safety Tips
safety.daylightDesc: Use public transportation and travel between cities during daylight hours when possible.
safety.valuablesDesc: Don't display expensive items. Use a money belt and keep copies of important documents.
safety.busesDesc: Keep bags in your lap on chicken buses. First-class buses have luggage compartments.
safety.itineraryDesc: Let someone know your travel plans, especially for remote destinations like Semuc Champey.

money.title: Money Tips
money.billsDesc: Bus drivers often don't have change for large bills. Carry 1, 5, and 10 quetzal notes.
money.negotiateDesc: Always agree on prices before getting in taxis or private shuttles to avoid disputes.
money.tipsDesc: Tip shuttle drivers, boat operators, and tour guides. 10-15% is standard for good service.
money.atmDesc: Withdraw cash in major cities. Rural areas have limited ATM access.

practical.title: Practical Tips
practical.packDesc: Chicken buses have limited space. Large backpacks may need to go on the roof.
practical.spanishDesc: Bus routes and schedules are rarely in English. Basic Spanish helps immensely.
practical.delaysDesc: Allow extra time for connections. Weather and road conditions can cause delays.
practical.snacksDesc: Long bus journeys may not include meal stops. Bring water and snacks.

booking.title: Booking Tips
booking.advanceDesc: Tourist shuttles fill up quickly during peak season (December-April, July-August).
booking.flightsDesc: Book flights to Flores/Tikal early morning to maximize time at the ruins.
booking.flexibleDesc: Chicken buses run frequently but don't follow strict schedules. First-class buses are more punctual.
booking.pickupDesc: Many shuttles offer hotel pickup. Confirm pickup time and location the day before.
